newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Macintosh sees fashion unit back in profit.
newsitem.headline: Macintosh sees fashion unit back in profit.

text.p: Dutch retailer Macintosh NV said on Thursday its loss-making Superconfex unit could very well return to profit this year.
"We think Superconfex can be out of the red in Belgium and as a whole in 1997, if the market cooperates," chairman Gert Beijer told reporters

"Fashion is a big market in Belgium and, like all sectors, it sometimes has a set-back. I'm confident a gradual improvement in the market will occur, and when it does, we'll be among those parties that can earn a good living in it," he said.

Beijer said it was hard to foresee the exact timing of any recovery in the Belgian clothing sector, but said the chain was working on its internal efficiency and in-store image, and would be ready to benefit from an upturn in the market when it came.
Macintosh earlier announced 1996 net profit of 2.7 million guilders, down from 22.5 million in 1995, and said it expected current year results to show a clear improvement over 1996.
Macintosh said it expected operational profit to improve in its Fashion and Living decoration/furniture businesses, while it forecast flat results from its Automotive division.
